arts.ttl: Kieffer Moore’s first-half strike earns World Cup qualifying win for Wales in Kazakhstan
arts.sum: All in yellow Kazakhstan, 114th in the Fifa rankings, represented a banana skin on an artificial surface in Astana. Their last World Cup qualifying victory was almost 12 years ago, a narrow success against the Faroe Islands, but this was anything but a straightforward win for Wales. By the end the chances were totting up, Craig Bellamy’s side clinging on with the Kazakhstan substitute Serizkhan Muzikov cracking the bar with a 95th-minute free-kick. The visitors were ultimately grateful for Kieffer Moore’s first-half winner, which was sufficient for a victory that keeps alive their hopes of automatic qualification from Group J. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Kazakhstan 0-1 Wales: Bellamy's side survive scare in Astana as Moore scores to claim spoils
arts.sum: Kazakhstan, during the opening exchanges of the second half, started more positively, and this was followed by Kenzhebek's efforts being expertly deflected after Darlow stretched to divert the ball onto the crossbar. Minutes later, the hosts were pressing more upfield, and after turning over the ball from Neco Williams, despite the Nottingham Forest player calling for a free kick.

arts.ttl: Kieffer Moore effort enough as Wales edge Kazakhstan in World Cup qualifier
arts.sum: Moore’s 15th goal for his country took him level with the great John Charles.

arts.ttl: Wales 'dig in' to top Group J after nervy win against Kazakhstan
arts.sum: Wales boss Craig Bellamy has insisted his side are better than what they showed during their narrow 1-0 World Cup qualifier victory against Kazakhstan which saw them move top of Group J.

arts.ttl: Kazakhstan v Wales: World Cup 2026 qualifier – live
arts.sum: Updates from the 3pm BST kick-off in Astana Mail Barry | How they stand | Sign up for Football Daily The Red Wall: Wales are expected to bring around a thousand supporters to Astana today but the odyssey undertaken by one bucket hat-wearing fan to get to his seat in the away end has really captured the public imagination. John McAllister left his home in Barry over five weeks ago and on a largely overland journey of 5,000 kilometres involving 17 train journeys and 11 bus trips, has taken in 11 different football matches, an ice hockey game, some random Irish bloke’s stag do and a heavy metal festival en route while compiling a fascinating YouTube travel vlog. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Kazakhstan v Wales live: Craig Bellamy’s side face World Cup qualifier after mammoth trip to central Asia
arts.sum: Wales beat Kazakhstan 3-1 when the two sides met in Cardiff in March

arts.ttl: Kazakhstan vs Wales – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Kazakhstan and Wales go head-to-head in the 2026 FIFA World Cup European qualifiers on Thursday. Both sides will be searching for crucial points in Group J, with Wales looking to maintain their second-place position while Kazakhstan fight to keep their faint World Cup dreams alive. arts.ttl: Horse riding and eating horse 'four ways' - Wales fans do Kazakhstan
arts.sum: More than 1,000 Wales fans have made the 7,000 mile round trip to Astana for the World Cup qualifier against Kazakhstan, with colourful tales to tell.

arts.ttl: Wales XI vs Kazakhstan – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Kazakhstan will host Wales at the Astana Arena in Astana on Thursday, 4 September 2025. This fixture kicks off Matchday 5 of Group J in the 2026 World Cup qualifiers.
